feed.title: PTCC - Pacific Tropical Cyclone Centre
feed.subtitle: An unofficial weather website with adequate information about tropical cyclones and tropical disturbances over the Pacific.

entry.title: Another severe earthquake…
entry.summary: 3 severe earthquakes around Santa Cruz Islands in 3 consecutive days… 6/2 – M8.0 7/2 – M6.7 8/2 – M7.1 Looks similar to the series of quakes occurred in Japan in March 2011…?
entry.content:
Latest earthquake near Santa Cruz Islands (from USGS)

3 severe earthquakes around Santa Cruz Islands in 3 consecutive days…

6/2 – M8.0
7/2 – M6.7
8/2 – M7.1

Looks similar to the series of quakes occurred in Japan in March 2011…?

entry.title: HK 10-DAY WEATHER OUTLOOK – REPORT NO. 002
entry.summary: HONG KONG 10-DAY WEATHER OUTLOOK – REPORT NO. 002 ***UNOFFICIAL*** (A) Time of Issurance 2013-02-01 (FRI) 17:00 HKT (B) Forecast Period 2013-02-01 (FRI) TO 2013-02-10 (SUN) (C) Summary Warm at first… Temperatures ranging between 17 to 23 degrees in the … Continue reading →
entry.content:
HONG KONG 10-DAY WEATHER OUTLOOK – REPORT NO. 002
***UNOFFICIAL***

(A) Time of Issurance
2013-02-01 (FRI) 17:00 HKT

(B) Forecast Period
2013-02-01 (FRI) TO 2013-02-10 (SUN)

(C) Summary
Warm at first… Temperatures ranging between 17 to 23 degrees in the next 7 days or so… Quite humid too… Some rain on coming Saturday evening and Sunday… Strong northeast monsoon expected to reach the coast on 8/2 (FRI) or 9/2 (SAT)… Temperature should fall below 12 degrees on Lunar New Year’s Eve… Not much sunshine in coming 10 days…

(D) Additional Information
Nil

(E) Weather Alert
Rain: Feb 02 – Feb 03 (SAT-SUN)
Heavy Rain: n/a
Tropical Cyclone: n/a
Very Hot: n/a
Cold: Feb 09 – Feb 10 (SAT-SUN)

(F) Next Report
2013-02-05 (TUE)

entry.content:
HONG KONG 10-DAY WEATHER OUTLOOK – REPORT NO. 001
***UNOFFICIAL***

(A) Time of Issurance
2013-01-29 (TUE) 17:30 HKT

(B) Forecast Period
2013-01-29 (TUE) TO 2013-02-07 (THU)

(C) Summary
No cold surge expected… Temperatures ranging between 16 to 22 degrees in the next 10 days… Generally warm through Friday… Northeast monsoon expected to bring us cloudy sky and a few rain patches during the weekend… Rather humid early next week…

(D) Additional Information
Nil

(E) Weather Alert
Rain: Feb 03 (SUN)
Heavy Rain: n/a
Tropical Cyclone: n/a
Very Hot: n/a
Cold: n/a

(F) Next Report
2013-02-01 (FRI)

entry.title: 94W flew to the north…
entry.summary: 94W is moving quickly to the north-northeast and it will be embedded within a sub-tropical low that is moving towards Japan… Tropical Cyclone formation is thus very unlikely…
entry.content: 94W is moving quickly to the north-northeast and it will be embedded within a sub-tropical low that is moving towards Japan… Tropical Cyclone formation is thus very unlikely…

entry.title: 94W bringing unsettled weather to the Philippine Sea…
entry.summary: Tropical Disturbance 94W is moving to the north slowly over the Philippine Sea… A gradual improvement in its organization is observed… The low level circulation centre is partially exposed to the southeast of major convective cells… OSCAT products in the … Continue reading →
entry.content:
IR 2013-01-11 1132Z (from NOAA)

Tropical Disturbance 94W is moving to the north slowly over the Philippine Sea… A gradual improvement in its organization is observed… The low level circulation centre is partially exposed to the southeast of major convective cells… OSCAT products in the morning revealed widespread Strong Force easterlies over the northern semicircle of 94W…

Over the past 3 hours… new convection has been building over the center… Good divergent flow… mainly poleward outflow… should support gradual development in the coming few days… 94W is expected to gain strength over the Philippine Sea… Latest numerical calculations expect a poleward movement followed by an acceleration to the northeast as a subtropical system early next week…

Residents in the Philippines should pay attention to local weather warnings issued by PAGASA…

entry.title: SONAMU dissipating…
entry.summary: Tropical Depression SONAMU is dissipating near 4N 111E due to severe vertical wind shear… Disorganization convective activities may bring heavy showers to parts of eastern Malaysia in the next couple of days… Another disturbance… 94W… is affecting southern Philippines and northeastern Indonesia… … Continue reading →
entry.content:
Tropical Depression SONAMU is dissipating near 4N 111E due to severe vertical wind shear… Disorganization convective activities may bring heavy showers to parts of eastern Malaysia in the next couple of days…

Another disturbance… 94W… is affecting southern Philippines and northeastern Indonesia… No Tropical Cyclone formation is expected during the next 3 days…

entry.title: TS SONAMU N of Kabupaten Natuna…
entry.summary: The partially-exposed centre of TS SONAMU is located near 6N 108E… south-southeast of Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam or north of Kabupaten Natuna, Indonesia… Maximum sustained wind speed around the centre is estimated to be about 65 km/h (35 kt)… Associated … Continue reading →
entry.content:
VIS 2013-01-07 0832Z (from NOAA)

The partially-exposed centre of TS SONAMU is located near 6N 108E… south-southeast of Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam or north of Kabupaten Natuna, Indonesia… Maximum sustained wind speed around the centre is estimated to be about 65 km/h (35 kt)… Associated convection is displaced to the west due to easterly shear of up to 25 kts…

The upper level environment is not suitable for development… SONAMU is forecast to lose strength and dissipate gradually as it drifts southwestward in the next couple of days…

SONAMU is not a big threat to the Malay Peninsula…

entry.title: TS SONAMU over the SCS…
entry.summary: Convection associated with SONAMU has increased slightly to make it a 75 km/h (40 kt) Tropical Storm… However… during the past few hours… southwesterly shear appears to be displacing SONAMU’s convection away from the low level circulation centre… Due to … Continue reading →
entry.content:
IR 2013-01-04 1032Z (from NOAA)

Convection associated with SONAMU has increased slightly to make it a 75 km/h (40 kt) Tropical Storm… However… during the past few hours… southwesterly shear appears to be displacing SONAMU’s convection away from the low level circulation centre…

Due to strong wind shear… SONAMU should not be able to reach Severe Tropical Storm strength while moving west to west-southwest over the South China Sea… The system will approach the Malay Peninsula as a weakening system early next week… Numerical models are in good agreement regarding the track of SONAMU…

At 09 UTC / 17 HKT… Nansha Dao reported a sea level pressure of 1005.4 hPa…

entry.title: 93W named SONAMU…
entry.summary: Tropical Disturbance 93W has intensified into a Tropical Depression… It was named SONAMU (T1301) by JMA… The low level circulation remained well-defined today as the system traveled across Mindanao… A small region of deep convection persists around the centre… Good … Continue reading →
entry.content:
IR 2013-01-03 1132Z (from NOAA)

Tropical Disturbance 93W has intensified into a Tropical Depression… It was named SONAMU (T1301) by JMA… The low level circulation remained well-defined today as the system traveled across Mindanao… A small region of deep convection persists around the centre… Good poleward outflow has been supporting SONAMU’s recent development…

Poleward outflow should continue to boost convective activities but rather strong vertical wind shear over the South China Sea should limit the rate of intensification… SONAMU is expected to become a Tropical Storm tomorrow…

A steady westward to west-southwestward motion is anticipated during the weekend… Numerical guidance shows SONAMU passing south of Vietnam and making its way to the Malay Peninsula…

Residents in Palawan should take suitable precautions to prevent loss… Heavy rain is expected tonight and tomorrow…

entry.title: The Landfall Game 2013
entry.summary: The Landfall Game 2013 has been kicked off! There are slight changes to the game rules. Winner(s) in 2013 will be awarded a small gift. =) http://www.pacificstorms.org/landfall-contest/
entry.content:
The Landfall Game 2013 has been kicked off!

There are slight changes to the game rules.
Winner(s) in 2013 will be awarded a small gift. =)

http://www.pacificstorms.org/landfall-contest/
